TextMeshPro.text: Custom instructions can be used to define a custom sequence of instructions to execute when called, but they cannot return a value. They are similar to a procedure in imperative programming.

After being created, this definition block will be placed in your program so you can define the exact instructions that this custom instruction should execute. Also, a new block will be created in the Custom Instructions panel on the left that you can use to call/execute this instruction in your program.
Custom expressions can be used to return a combination of expressions and return a value, but they cannot execute instructions. They are similar to a function in functional programming.

After being created, this definition block will be placed in your program so you can define what exactly it will return. Also, a new block will be created in the Custom Expressions panel on the left that you can use to call/execute this expression in your program.
